item.title: Deep learning - Convolutional neural networks and feature extraction with Python
item.description:
Deep learning - Convolutional neural networks and feature extraction with Python

Convolutional neural networks (or ConvNets) are biologically-inspired variants of MLPs, they have different kinds of layers and each different layer works different than the usual MLP layers. If you are interested in learning more about ConvNets, a good course is the CS231n - Convolutional Neural Newtorks for Visual Recognition.

item.title: Real-time Resizing of Flickr Images Using GPUs
item.description:
Real-time Resizing of Flickr Images Using GPUs

At Flickr we work with a huge number of photos. Our users upload over 27 million photos a day, and our total collection has over 12 billion photos. This is fantastic! As usage grows, we are always looking for ways to use our storage more efficiently.

item.title: Projeto Casa Rodante: Cidadania nas ruas da Luz
item.description:
Projeto Casa Rodante: Cidadania nas ruas da Luz

O projeto Casa Rodante, desenvolvido pelo coletivo artístico casadalapa em parceria com a Secretaria de Direitos Humanos e Cidadania de São Paulo, é uma iniciativa artística e social que tem como cenário a região da Luz, no centro da cidade de São Paulo.

item.title: O Canto das Mulheres do Asfalto Estimad...
item.description:
O Canto das Mulheres do Asfalto Estimad...

O Canto das Mulheres do Asfalto Estimada Platéia. O Canto das Mulheres do Asfalto é uma peça onde as mulheres decidem não mais ter filhos. Mas não é luta de gênero não. Não é greve de sexo não.

item.description:

item.title: What Happens Next Will Amaze You
item.description:
What Happens Next Will Amaze You

Soon the web was infested with all manner of trackers, beacons, pixels, tracking cookies and bugs. Companies learned to pool their data so they could follow customers across many sites. They created user profiles of everyone using the web.

item.title: Torch | Recurrent Model of Visual Attention
item.description:
Torch | Recurrent Model of Visual Attention

In this blog post, I want to discuss how we at Element-Research implemented the recurrent attention model (RAM) described in[1]. Not only were we able to reproduce the paper, but we also made of bunch of modular code available in the process. You can reproduce the RAM on the MNIST dataset using this training script.

item.title: Building a Deep Learning (Dream) Machine
item.description:
Building a Deep Learning (Dream) Machine

As a PhD student in Deep Learning, as well as running my own consultancy, building machine learning products for clients I'm used to working in the cloud and will keep doing so for production-oriented systems/algorithms. There are however huge drawbacks to cloud-based systems for more research oriented tasks where you mainly want to try out various algorithms and architectures, to iterate and move fast.

item.title: Exploring the Darker Side of Fashion
item.description:
Exploring the Darker Side of Fashion

Carol Christian Poell In Linz, Austria, a new exhibition explores the darker side of fashion since the 1980s, when the likes of Alexander McQueen, Martin Margiela, and Rei Kawakubo started following melancholic tendencies that had hitherto been reserved for the other visual arts and literature.

item.title: Google's Demis Hassabis - misuse of artificial intelligence 'could do harm' - BBC News
item.description:
Google's Demis Hassabis - misuse of artificial intelligence 'could do harm' - BBC News

It is a technology so powerful that - on a distant day well into the future - it could mean computers that are able to advise on the best way to treat patients, tackle climate change or feed the poor. With such potential power, comes huge responsibility.
